name: Overview
main:
Following floods in northern and central areas of the country in August and September, almost 7 million people are considered in need of humanitarian assistance in Bangladesh, with 3 million needing targeted assistance. Priority needs are WASH, food, nutrition, and shelter assistance.? At the same time, an influx of Rohingya refugees into Cox’s Bazar in the southeast of the country has been steadily increasing since late August, with the current number at almost 90,000. Needs among Rohingyas are high, as they flee a major government crackdown in Rakhine state, Myanmar. Prior to this development, Bangladesh was already hosting almost 600,000 Rohingya refugees.?

INFORM measures Bangladesh's risk of humanitarian crisis and disaster to be high, at 5.8/10. Bangladesh’s exposure to hazards is of particular concern, at 7.5/10.?
latest_developments_past: 11/09: 313,000 Rohingya refugees have entered Bangladesh. The number tripled within a week. There is an increasing need for cross-sectoral response. The government of Bangladesh and humanitarian actors are struggling to cope with the influx.???
